definition: to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

sentences.english: Could all that talk of the Golden Company sailing west have been a feint?
sentences.chinese: 那些關於黃金團向西起航的傳言難道是聲東擊西？

sentences.english: The landing in Normandy is merely a diversionary maneuver.
sentences.chinese: 諾曼底登陸只是聲東擊西的陽動。

sentences.english: This is his versed trick, what's called "selling the drummy".
sentences.chinese: 這是他所精通的“聲東擊西”的伎倆。

sentences.english: Moment he diversion, while laughing off the language.
sentences.chinese: 他一會兒聲東擊西，一會兒笑而不語。

definition: Pang Juan (-342 BC), military leader and political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
